item.description:
“I've looked at photographs of myself during concerts and it sometimes looks as if I'm in a fencing move, with a guitar in my hands instead of a sword.”—Neil Diamond

We can’t promise that you will look as good as Neil or even make it look as easy has he does, but we can guarantee you will learn the basics have a lot of fun in the process. TTDB is very excited to offer our first Fencing 101 Class. Here’s how it works:

Fencing is a sport that can be learned and enjoyed by almost anyone. Fencing develops balance, agility and coordination. The physical demands of fencing increase gradually as you learn the particular movements needed for the sport. However, if you can climb a flight of stairs without difficulty, you will be able to learn to fence during our 101 class.

We will be learning at The Boston Fencing Club, the nation’s oldest fencing club, tracing its roots back to 1858. The class will include a brief overview of the sport, introduction to basic techniques and an opportunity to spar with your fellow students.

Let’s not let Neil steal our thunder and join TTDB for the real thing! Come out and try something new with some great people.


Suggested Attire: Participants should wear athletic clothing (sweatpants, t-shirts, sneakers). No shorts.

Directions: Google Maps should handle any directions you may need.

If you have an issue with needing public transportation, please contact me to see if we can work something out.

Brian- 508-269-0954

To purchase tickets go to:
www.thingstodoboston.com
Click on "See the full Calendar"

Cost: $20.00
If purchased by- 4/24/09
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet you at the entrance
item.name: Fencing 101
